DOC.detailed_description: The study conduct primary care environment two distinct , yet representative healthcare system San Diego County : Neighborhood Healthcare ( San Diego County FQHC system designate Patient-Centered Medical Home , serve predominantly ethnic minority , low income patient ) Scripps ( large , non-profit , private insurance-based health system , serve predominantly Caucasian , middle-to-higher income patient ) . Six hundred patient intervention ( n=2 ; patient N=300 ) control ( n=2 ; patient N=300 ) clinic , age 18 old , T2DM , glycosylated hemoglobin ( HbA1c ) ≥ 8.0 % , and/or low-density lipoprotein cholesterol ( LDL-C ) ≥ 100 mg/dL , and/or systolic blood pressure ( SBP ) ≥ 140 within last 60 day , identify enrol use electronic health record ( EHRs ) . Primary clinical outcome HbA1c , LDL-C , SBP assess part quarterly ( annual , LDL-C ) , standard-of-care medical visit extract EHRs 12 month . Changes patient-reported behavioral ( diabetes self-care ) psychosocial ( quality life , patient activation ) outcomes evaluated via telephone assessment subset intervention control ( N=300 total ) participant baseline , month 6 , month 12 . A thorough process evaluation conduct establish reach , acceptability/feasibility , adoption/maintenance , fidelity intervention integrate patient , MA , primary care provider perspective . Cost-effectiveness also examine health system perspective . Principles community engage research incorporate intervention study planning sustain throughout research period .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Must patient select Scripps Neighborhood Healthcare clinic , 2 . Must age 18 year old , 3 . Must T2DM diagnosis , 4 . Must show evidence poor clinical control , define HbA1c ≥ 8 % and/or LDLC ≥ 100 mg/dL , and/or SBP ≥ 140 mmHg . None pragmatic trial .
